name: textually
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a way that relates to written or printed material: The dilemma of a textually based religion is that it must apply the teachings of its scripture to the practical experience of the modern world. The information in the talk is also available textually.
relating to the way in which something has been written: The critic claims that the author's work is influenced by fairy tales, but nowhere is this textually supported. The novel is a textually rich work with lyrical writing that carries the reader through a complex plot.
More examplesFewer examplesHer research has demonstrated the difference between how children process information that is presented textually, compared to that which is presented graphically.
